description.h4: Bound to freedom, nature and egoism
description.p: Every magic-using creature has it's own ways to approach the magic of the multiverse. Casting spells may be one of the most common using to access magic. Next to this, a Witch has their own little spells known as Hexes. They even may brew some potions or craft a little Charm with positive or negative effects to it's owner. If good or bad is just a matter of perspektive. However, for a Witch it mighty always be good since they only do what they want. And what the want is to live for their freedom and their own entertainment. Sure a witch may accompany others or agree to job offerings, but always out of own personal profit. Rarely to actually help.

Speaking of Charms and Hexes. Never try to enter a cave or other housing of a witch if you are not prepared to have a massive headache, a missing finger or even worse afterwards. Maybe you'll loose some blood just because of a thirsty Hag which wants to taste your blood.

When deciding to play a Witch, think about what kind of Witch your character is and where they lives. Your Witch could be a casual old Hag living in a small hut somewhere in the swamps. Or, your Witch is a mistress, a beautiful lady living in the city next to some boring mudbloods. And yes, your witch can be of any gender you like or even a construct, since beeing a Witch is all about living your freedom.
How did your character come to be an adventurer? Maybe you need to travel around to collect all the knowledge spread around the multiverse or you are just hungry for power.

You can make a Witch quickly by following these suggestions. First, Charisma should be your highest ability score, followed by Constitution and Wisdom. Second, select the Noble or Hermit background. Third, select the Fire Bolt, Shocking Grasp and Ray of Frost or Light cantrips. Fourth, select the Burning Hands, Thunderwave and Mage Armor spells.
As a Witch, you gain the following class features

ul.li: Hit Points at 1st Level: 6 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d6 (or 4) + your Constitution modifier per Witch level after 1st
Weapons: Blowguns, daggers, darts, quarterstaffs, sickles, slings
Tools: Alchemist's Supplies and Herbalism Kit
Skills: Choose two from Arcana, History, Insight, Investigation and Nature

description.p: You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

ul.li: (a) a quarterstaff, (b) a dagger or (c) a sickle
(a) a sling and 20 sling bullet or (b) 10 darts
(a) a component pouch or (b) a spellcasting focus

sheet.description: A lover of freedom and themself.

setters.set: A lover of freedom and themself.

description.p: It is possible for you to slighty weave the fine lines of magic all around us. From birth or by a contract to a greater beeing you got the ability to use magic.

At 1st level, you know two cantrips of your choice from the Witch spell list. You learn additional Witch cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Witch table.

The Witch table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your Witch spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these Witch spells, you must expend a slot of the spell’s level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
description.h5: Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher
description.p: You know two 1st-level spells of your choice from the Witch spell list.

The Spells Known column of the Witch table shows when you learn more Witch spells of your choice. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 3rd level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the Witch spells you know and replace it with another spell from the Witch spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your Witch spells, since the power of your magic relies on your ability to bend the magic to your will. You use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a Witch spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

center.p: Spell save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier
Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier

description.p: You can cast any Witch spell you know as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag. While doing that you don’t expend a spell slot.
You can use any kind focus as a spellcasting focus for your Witch spells.

sheet.description: You can cast magic.

description.p: At 1st level, you gain a companion that accompanies you on your adventures and is trained to fight alongside you. Choose a beast that is no larger than Medium and that has a challenge rating of 1/4 or lower. Add half your proficiency bonus rounded down to the companions AC, attack roll, attack dmg, skills and saving throws that the companion is proficient in. It's max HP equals four times your Witch level. Like any creature, it can spend Hit Dice during a short rest to regain hit points.
The beast acts independently from you on it's own turn. You can verbally command your companion to specify what it shall do.

If you are incapacitated or absent, the beast acts on its own, focusing on protecting you and itself. The beast never requires your command to use its reaction, such as when making an opportunity attack.
If the beast dies, it disappears instead into a private pocket dimension. You can spend one hour to summon it again.
You can telepathically communicate with your familiar within 60 feet.

sheet.description: You have a beast as your familiar. Whenever your familiar attacks, add half your proficiency bonus rounded down to the companions attack roll and attack dmg. The beast acts independently from you on it's own turn. You can verbally command your companion to specify what it shall do. If you are incapacitated or absent, the beast acts on its own, focusing on protecting you and itself. The beast never requires your command to use its reaction, such as when making an opportunity attack. If the beast dies, it disappears instead into a private pocket dimension. You can spend one hour to summon it again. You can telepathically communicate with your familiar within 60 feet.

description.p: At 2nd level, you can reach out to spirits to guide you and others. You are able to channel spirits and communicate with them. The communication is not limited. You may ask as many questions as you like but be aware wich spirits you are channeling, some may not answer as you like, if they answer, or try to attack your consciousness. As you channeling, some spirits may attempt to take over your body with or without permission. If the latter you may attempt to fight back with a wisdom saving throw against a DC determined by the DM, as the spirits may have different levels of power to do so. While your body is possessed you can still see and hear what's happening but you cannot act or speak. To take back the control of your body the spirit must leave on it's own or you have to succeed on a charisma ability check against the spirits wisdom.

sheet.description: You are able to channel spirits and communicate with them. The communication is not limited. You may ask as many questions as you like but be aware wich spirits you are channeling, some may not answer as you like, if they answer, or try to attack your consciousness. As you channeling, some spirits may attempt to take over your body with or without permission. If the latter you may attempt to fight back with a wisdom saving throw against a DC determined by the DM, as the spirits may have different levels of power to do so. While your body is possessed you can still see and hear what's happening but you cannot act or speak. To take back the control of your body the spirit must leave on it's own or you have to succeed on a charisma ability check against the spirits wisdom.

description.p: At 3rd level, you gain three Witchcrafts. When you gain certain Witch levels, you gain additional Witchcrafts of your choice, as shown in the Witchcrafts Known column of the Witch table. You can craft Charms, brew Potions or cast Hexes.

Charms are little trinkets you can craft from wood and other common materials. They grant certain effects to it's wearer for a limited time. It takes 10 minutes to craft a Charm and their magic last for one hour. Charms increase the affected attribute by half of your proficiency bonus rounded down if not written otherwise within the description of the charm.

Hexes are like spells but do not count against the number of spells known. Hexes are treated like curses or buffs and take a bonus action to cast. The effect and duration of a Hex varies and is written in the corresponding Witchcraft. If you cast a Hex the target may succeed on a wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC to avoid the hex. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of it's turn to end the hex.

You are also able to brew potions if you have the required tools. Each potion needs water as a base and several other ingredients. In suitable areas you can try to collect those ingredients. Those areas may be caves, woods and coasts. As every potion needs different ingredients, determine with your DM if you can collect the needed ingredients in your current area. Otherwise you can buy the ingredients for three quarters of the price which the potion would usually costs. The time needed to collect ingredients and brew the potion is written in the corresponding Witchcraft. You are able to combine several potion's effects into one potion. If you do so you have to provide the same materials as if you brew each potion on it's own. The time spend to brew that combined potion is determined by the potion which would take the longest. If you obtain potion formulas during your adventures in other ways than by Witchcrafts and you picked the Potion Crafting Witchcraft, you can handle them as Witchcraft Potions and the don't count against the number of Witchcrafts known.

Crafting a Charm or casting a Hex requires one usage of the Witchcraft feature. Brewing a potion doesn't. You can use this feature up to a number equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can craft Charms, cast Hexes and brew Potions. To brew a Potion you must provide the materials needed but not expend a usage of this feature. Charms take 10 minutes to craft and last for one hour. Hexes take a bonus action to cast. The target must succeed a DC{{spellcasting:dc:cha}} wisdom saving to avoid the Hex. Otherwise, the target can retry this saving throw at the end of it's turn.

description.p: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

At 5th level, you can use an action to magically transform your familiar into the shape of a beast that you have seen before. You can use this feature twice and regain expended uses when you finish a short or long rest. You can use both usages of this feature to let the familiar transform into a stronger beast. One point equals a challenge rating of 1/2. This increases to challenge rating 1 at 8th level. You can also choose a beast of a lower rating to transform your familiar into.

Your familiar can stay in a that shape for a number of hours equal to half your Witch level (rounded down). It then revert to it's normal form unless you expend another use of this feature. Your familiar can revert to it's normal form earlier by using a bonus action on it's turn. Your familiar automatically revert if it falls unconscious, drops to 0 hit points, or dies.
While your familiar is transformed, the following rules apply:

ul.li: The game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the beast, but the familiar retains it's alignment, personality, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. It also retains all of your skill and saving throw proficiencies, in addition to gaining those of the creature. If the creature has the same proficiency as your familiar and the bonus in its stat block is higher than the familiar's, use the creature’s bonus instead. If the creature has any legendary or lair actions, they can't be used.

When your familiar transforms, ir assumes the beast’s hit points and Hit Dice. When it reverts to it's normal form, it returns to the number of hit points it had before it transformed. However, if your familiar reverts as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to it's normal form. As long as the excess damage doesn’t reduce your familiar's normal form to 0 hit points, it isn’t knocked unconscious.
Your familiar's actions are limited to the capabilities of the beast form.

sheet.description: Your familiar can magically assume the shape of a beast that you have seen before. It can stay in a beast shape for {{witch:familiar:shapeshift:hours}} hours. It then reverts to your normal form unless you expend another use of this feature. Your familiar can revert to it's normal form earlier by using a bonus action on it's turn. It automatically reverts if it falls unconscious, drops to 0 hit points, or dies.

description.p: At 7th level, you can now telepathically communicate with your familiar within a range of 120 feet.

Additionally, you can cast spells and Hexes as if you were standing in its location and you can take a reaction that when you, or the familiar, takes damage you can split the damage in half between you and the familiar.

sheet.description: You can now telepathically communicate with your familiar within a range of 120 feet. Additionally, you can cast spells and Hexes as if you were standing in its location and you can take a reaction that when you, or the familiar, takes damage you can split the damage in half between you and the familiar.

description.p: At 9th level, you are now able to upgrade one of your Witchcrafts to a Major Witchcraft instead of taking a new Witchcraft as you get to choose a new Witchcraft as you level up.

At 11th level, you gain the ability to infuse objects with magic to make 'em dance. You gain the Animate Objects spell, which does not count against the number of Witch spells you know. You can use this spell once per short rest without expending a spell slot or materials used to cast this spell.

Additionally, you can touch a suitable object (i.e.: a broom or a carpet) to fly with it. This object can carry you, your familiar and a number of other creatures depending on the choosen object. Determine with your DM how many additional creatures you may take with you.

sheet.description: You can cast Animate Objects once per short rest without expending a spell slot or materials used to cast this spell. Additionally, you can touch a suitable object (i.e.: a broom or a carpet) to fly with it. This object can carry you, your familiar and a number of other creatures depending on the choosen object. Determine with your DM how many additional creatures you may take with you.

description.p: At 13th level, you now add your full proficiency bonus instead of half to your Familiars AC, attack roll, attack dmg, skills and saving throws that it is proficient in.
Additionally, you can choose elementals with your Familiar's Shapeshift feature too.

sheet.description: Whenever your familiar attacks, add your proficiency bonus rounded down (instead of half) to the companions attack roll and attack dmg. Additionally, you can choose elementals with your Familiar's Shapeshift feature too.

description.p: At 15th level, you are now able to upgrade one of your Major Witchcrafts to a Grand Witchcraft instead of taking a new Witchcraft as you get to choose a new Witchcraft as you level up.

At 18th level, you know enough about death to cheat it. You now have advantage on death saving throws and when you roll a 1 on the d20 when making a death saving throw, it only counts as one failure, rather than two as normal.
Additionally, you cannot die of old age.

sheet.description: You have advantage on death saving throws and when you roll a 1 on the d20 when making a death saving throw, it only counts as one failure, rather than two as normal. You cannot die of old age.

description.p: At 20th level, you can choose up to three of your Witchcrafts and use them without expending a use of your Witchcraft feature. If you choose a potion you instead take half the time to collect the ingredients and half the time to brew that potion.

sheet.description: You can choose up to three of your Witchcrafts and use them without expending a use of your Witchcraft feature. If you choose a potion you instead take half the time to collect the ingredients and half the time to brew that potion.

description.p: The target's AC is increased by 3.

sheet.description: The target's AC is increased by 3.

description.p: Declare a damage type of which the target takes increased dmg to equal of 1d10 + your charisma modifier.

sheet.description: Declare a damage type of which the target takes increased dmg to equal of 1d10 + {{charisma:modifier}}.

description.p: Declare a damage type of which the target takes reduced dmg to equal of 1d10 + your charisma modifier.

sheet.description: Declare a damage type of which the target takes reduced dmg to equal of 1d10 + {{charisma:modifier}}.

description.p: The target takes 1d8 + your charisma modifier psychic dmg at the start of each of it's turn.

sheet.description: The target takes 1d8 + {{charisma:modifier}} psychic dmg at the start of each of it's turn.

description.p: The target heals for 1d8 + your charisma modifier at the start of each of it's turn.

sheet.description: The target heals for 1d8 + your charisma modifier at the start of each of it's turn.

description.p: You learn the formula of a common potion of your choice. It takes you one hours to collect the ingredients and four hour to brew them. You can choose this Witchcraft again to learn an additional formula of a common potion.

sheet.description: You learn the formula of a common potion of your choice. It takes you one hours to collect the ingredients and four hour to brew them. You can choose this Witchcraft again to learn an additional formula of a common potion.

You learn the formula of an uncommon potion of your choice. It takes you two hours to collect the ingredients and five hour to brew them. You can choose this Witchcraft again to learn an additional formula of a uncommon potion.

sheet.description: You learn the formula of an uncommon potion of your choice. It takes you two hours to collect the ingredients and five hour to brew them. You can choose this Witchcraft again to learn an additional formula of a uncommon potion.

description.p: You learn the formula of an uncommon potion of your choice. It takes you two hours to collect the ingredients and five hour to brew them. You can choose this Witchcraft again to learn an additional formula of a uncommon potion.

You learn the formula of a rare or very rare potion of your choice. For a rare potion it takes you three hours to collect the ingredients and six hour to brew them. For a very rare potion it takes you four hours to collect the ingredients and seven hour to brew them. You can choose this Witchcraft again to learn an additional formula of a rare or very rare potion potion. Altogether, you can only learn one formula of a very rare potion using your Witchcraft feature.

sheet.description: You learn the formula of a rare or very rare potion of your choice. For a rare potion it takes you three hours to collect the ingredients and six hour to brew them. For a very rare potion it takes you four hours to collect the ingredients and seven hour to brew them. You can choose this Witchcraft again to learn an additional formula of a rare or very rare potion potion. Altogether, you can only learn one formula of a very rare potion using your Witchcraft feature.

For a very rare potion it takes you four hours to collect the ingredients and seven hour to brew them. You can choose this Witchcraft again to learn an additional formula of a rare or very rare potion potion. Altogether, you can only learn one formula of a very rare potion using your Witchcraft feature.
